alert.note: Alert for Shannon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 11:00AM CST until March 04 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Current River near Powder Mill affecting Shannon County. Jacks Fork at Alley Spring affecting Shannon County. Roubidoux Creek Near Waynesville affecting Pulaski County. Big Piney below Fort Leonard Wood -East Gate affecting Pulaski County. James River near Boaz affecting Stone and Christian Counties. James River at Galena affecting Stone County. Gasconade River at Jerome affecting Phelps County. .Runoff from rainfall accumulations of two to three inches with isolated higher amounts will likely lead to the rivers rising above flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Jacks Fork at Alley Spring. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, water impacts Alley Spring Campground. Water is one foot in depth at the 600, 800 and 900 loop camp sites. At 11.0 feet, much of Alley Spring Campground floods. Water flows through Alley Spring Campground and isolates the 200 Area Camp Sites. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CST Friday the stage was 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 9.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
